title: Effectiveness of percutaneous cement injection on proximal junctional failure after posterior lumbar interbody fusion
patient: A 69-year-old woman underwent PLIF, at the L1-S1 level, and lumbar kyphoscoliosis in May 2015 for correction of spinal stenosis, instability of multiple segments of the lumbosacral spine, and degenerative kyphoscoliosis of the lumbar spine. In July 2015, she complained of buttock and low back pain. A T12, L1 vertebra compression fracture, and L1 screw pullout to the superior endplate were revealed on X-ray (Fig. A). She underwent PCI in the T12 and L1 vertebra bodies, and discoplasty at the T12-L1 level (Fig. B). Progression of local kyphosis and T12, L1 vertebral body fractures was seen on X-ray at the last follow-up (Fig. C). In February 2016, she underwent PLIF extension at the T3-L1 level because of severe back pain with neurogenic claudication.
